title: Can't Open Patcher
body: I can't open the patcher without an error being displayed, specifically "PVP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working" error. Even after I uninstalled and reinstalled the game, I can't open it. I've tried the un/reinstall, running as an admin, disabling the firewall and it still won't open without the error. Pls help {{item:3070}}  {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
[Grant League permission to run on your computer!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Annie_3.jpg
I tried all of those and most were already done, but I still can't log in :(
Tried all of those too. Can't get the patcher to open without the PVP.Net Kernel crashing so I can't repair files or anything either.

It's possible that you need to complete a clean reinstallation of League in order to resolve the issue. Grab Riot's [Hextech Repair Tool](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/player-support/tools/Hextech%20Repair%20Tool.msi) and check both the box for 'Reinstall' and 'Clean Uninstall', then hit the Start button. This will wipe all files associated with League to ensure corruption doesn't carry over, then reinstalls the game.
I ran in and selected clean reinstall but the same problem still persists.

Thanks for all the troubleshooting you've done so far!  Please reach out to us by [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and our tech team can look further into this.  The Hextech Repair Tool should have also provided some logs, which you can attach to that ticket for context.  Thanks for your patience, you'll be in good hands!
Thanks for the response, but I did submit a ticket at some point in the troubleshooting; I haven't gotten a response yet but I'll keep waiting.

I'm sure a Rioter will get mad at me for suggesting you dig into their files but I found a post on a forum when I had this problem and the solution presented worked for me when there was no issue with my permissions or firewalls. 

Go into your League of Legends folder in C:/Riot Games
Open up the "RADS" folder.
Open up the "Projects" folder.
Open up the "lol_air_client" folder.
Open up the "releases" folder.
Open up the folder that's in there. It changes every patch, but contains the same stuff.
Delete the two files named "S_OK" and "release manifest"
Open up the "deploy" folder.
Delete the "logs", "META-INF", "lol.properties", and "LoLClient.exe"
Restart your Patcher.
It will repatch the recent patch you had just downloaded.

I'm not sure if you have any custom DNS/IPconfig settings set up or any custom Port Forwarding but I would imagine that these could also present a problem in this scenario. 

Hope this helps!
~KP

P.S. Please don't get mad at me Riot... XD

EDIT: If none of this works you may want to check for OS updates from Windows or Apple (depending on whose software you're using) sometimes updates will fix these problems. These problems may also come from updates if you have recently updated your PC OS was well. It may take some digging but Porocles may be right that it is a permissions issue brought on by a windows/mac update.

I did try to delete those folders while they were still around, but when you first install League before you patch it for the first time, those files don't exist (which unfortunately is the part I'm stuck at). Thanks though.
